page.title: 20Ufton and Area-June 1985.
page.content: The impression is of a neat, well kept residential village with the busy A425 running through the centre. Crossing the road can be very dangerous due to the sharp bend by the traffic island opposite the church. There is one bus shelter;one post box (another at Bascote Heath);one telephone box;twelve street lamps and two litter bins. The one public building, apart from the church, is the village hall built in 1923. The main part of the village consists of Harbury Lane with St.Michaels Cl; Broad Cl. and Reeds Park off it.School Lane is "one-way" past the pub. Bascote Heath is approached along a tree lined road with the houses set back in the fields. There is one wood- built public house with garden.
